Comment.Language: For the Commemoration of St. Mena:

Text.Language: Eswp oun n~te pirwmi: jemh/ou m~pikocmoc t/rf: n~tef]o~ci n~tef'u,/: ou pe pai wnq n~e~v~l/ou.
What will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world and loses his soul? O the futility of this life!

Pia~gioc a~pa M/na: afcwtem n~ca ]c~m/ n~nou]: af,w m~pikocmoc t/rf n~cwf: nem pefw~ou eynatako.
The saint Abba Mina, heard the divine voice, and forsook the whole world, and its corrupt glory.

Af] n~tef'~u,/ e~v~mou: nem pefcwma e~pi,~rwm: afsep hannis] m~bacanoc: eybe Ps/ri m~V] etonq.
He gave his soul up to death, and his flesh to the fire, and accepted great torment, For the Son of the living God.
ÙˆØ¨Ø°Ù„ Ù†Ù?Ø³Ù‡ Ù„Ù„Ù…ÙˆØª ÙˆØ¬Ø³Ø¯Ù‡ Ù„Ù„Ù†Ø§Ø± ÙˆÙ‚Ø¨Ù„ Ø¹Ø°Ø§Ø¨Ø§Øª Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ…Ø© Ù„Ø£Ø¬Ù„ Ø§Ø¨Ù† Ø§Ù„Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙŠ.
Eybe vai a~Pencwt/r: olf e~qoun e~tefmetouro: af] naf n~nia~gayon: n/e~te m~pebal nau e~rwou.
Therefore, our Savior lifted him up to His kingdom, And granted him the good things that no eye has seen.

<ere nak w~ pimarturoc: ,ere piswij n~genneoc: ,ere piaylovoroc: pia~gioc a~pa M/na. (apa M/na n~te nivaiat)
Hail to you, O martyr: Hail to the noble hero: Hail to the struggle-bearer: Saint Abba Mina.
